Escape From The Cyber World! 1.0 documentation
Escape From The Cyber World! 1.0 documentation
  • Guide

Back to top

Technical documentation**#

Data modules#

load_all.py:#

The module is used to fill in the tables: NPCs, Enemies, Dialogs, Tasks, Protagonists, Locations.

Functions:

load_all - The function fills in the listed tables.

load_all.load_all()#

The function for filling in all database tables.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only fill the tables.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get error of filling data.

load_data.py:#

The module is used to fill in the tables: NPCs, Enemies, Dialogs, Tasks, Protagonists.

Functions:

load_data - The function fills in the listed tables.

load_data.load_data()#

The function for filling in all database tables without map.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only fill the tables.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get error of filling data.

load_map.py:#

The module is used to fill in the table Locations.

Functions:

load_map - The function fill in the table.

load_map.load_map()#

The function for filling map table.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only fill the table.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get error of filling data.

data.py:#

The data.

This module is used as a collection of data required for uploading to databases, also file can also be imported as a module.

Database modules#

database.py:#

The module has the minimum and necessary functionality to work with the database.

Functions:

configuration_database - The function parses all the necessary database parameters. connection_database - The function connects to the database. close_connection_database - The function disconnects from the database. drop_tables - The function deletes all existing tables. create_tables - The function creates tables if they do not exist. load_information - The function completely fills in the table. get_row - The function writes one entity to a table.

database.close_connection_database(connection)#

The function to close database connection.

Parameters:

connection (psycopg2.extensions.connection.) – The connector to the database.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only changes the state of the connector.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If it was not possible to connect to the database.

database.configuration_database(filename: str = 'database.ini', section: str = 'postgresql')#

The function to configure connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • filename (str.) – The file names for getting connection parameters.

  • section (str.) – The dbms names.

Returns:

The dictionary of connection parameters.

Return type:

dict.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

database.connection_database()#

The database connection function.

Returns:

The connector to the database.

Return type:

psycopg2.extensions.connection.

Raise:

Exception: If it was not possible to connect to the database.

database.create_tables()#

The function of creating database tables.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only changes the state of the connector.

Return type:

None.

database.drop_tables(tables: list)#

The function to drop all existing tables.

Parameters:

tables (list.) – The list of tables name.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only changes the state of the connector.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we don’t get tables names.

database.get_row(data_number: int, table_name: str)#

The function for getting a specific row of an arbitrary table.

Parameters:

  • data_number (int.) – The number of string in the database.

  • table_name (str.) – The name of the table for requests.

Returns:

Return turple of values for one entity in database.

Return type:

tuple.

Raise:

Exception: If we get argument of incorrect type.

database.load_information(loading_data: list)#

The function for uploading data to the database.

Parameters:

loading_data (list.) – The list of sql queries.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but changed connector status.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get argument of incorrect type.

additional.py:#

The module of additional functions necessary for the bot to work.

Functions:

clear_string - The function of clearing the string of unnecessary characters. get_time - Function for getting a current time. get_date - Function for getting a current date. get_name - Function for getting a random name. get_surname - Function for getting a random surname. get_dialogs - A function for getting a dialog in the form of a tuple of lists. print_dialogs - The function prints the entire dialogue between the protagonist and the NPC.

additional.clear_string(text: str)#

The function for clearing the text of the characters of the film adaptation.

Parameters:

text (str.) – The text that will be cleaned.

Returns:

The cleaned line.

Return type:

str.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

additional.get_date()#

The function of getting the current date.

Returns:

The date.

Return type:

str.

additional.get_dialogs(location_id: int)#

The function of creating a tuple of a hero’s dialogue with an unknown NPC.

Parameters:

location_id (int.) – The location from which we take data.

Returns:

A turple of replicas of each character.

Return type:

tuple.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

additional.get_name()#

The function to get random protagonist name.

Returns:

The random name.

Return type:

str.

additional.get_surname()#

The function to get random protagonist surname.

Returns:

The random surname.

Return type:

str.

additional.get_time()#

The function of getting the current time.

Returns:

The time.

Return type:

str.

async additional.print_dialogs(dialogs: tuple, message: Message)#

The function for displaying all dialog messages.

Parameters:

  • dialogs (tuple.) – The phrases.

  • message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

A turple of replicas of each character.

Return type:

tuple.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

Entities modules#

enemy.py:#

This one is responsible for all actions with the class representative Enemy.

Classes:

Enemy - A class for an analog of working with an enemy.

Functions:

set_enemy - A function for filling in the data fields of a class representative Enemy.

class enemy.Enemy(enemy_id: int | None = None, enemy_armor: int | None = None, enemy_health: int | None = None, enemy_agility: int | None = None, enemy_strength: int | None = None, enemy_name: str | None = None)#

This is a conceptual class representation of an Enemy.

Parameters:

  • enemy_id (int.) – Unique number of the enemy.

  • enemy_armor (int.) – The armor of the enemy.

  • enemy_health (int.) – The health of the enemy.

  • enemy_agility (int.) – The agility of the enemy.

  • enemy_strength (int.) – The strength of the enemy.

  • enemy_name (str.) – The name of the enemy.

async print_parameters(message: Message)#

The method outputs the necessary information about enemy.

Parameters:

message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only outputs to the chat.

Return type:

None.

enemy.set_enemy(current_location: Location)#

The function of setting data for a specific enemy.

Parameters:

current_location (Location.) – The location from which we take data for the enemy.

Returns:

A representative of the class with the completed data.

Return type:

Enemy.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

location.py:#

This one is responsible for all actions with the class representative Location.

Classes:

Location - A class for an analog of working with a location.

class location.Location(location_id: int, location_item: str, location_name: str, location_npc_id: int, location_top_side: int, location_bot_side: int, location_enemy_id: int, location_type: str, location_left_side: int, location_right_side: int, location_description: str, current_required_item: str, location_area: str)#

This is a conceptual class representation of a Location.

Parameters:

  • location_id (int.) – Unique number of the location.

  • location_item (int.) – The item that is located on the location.

  • location_name (str.) – The name of the location.

  • location_npc_id (int.) – The unique number of npc whose is on location.

  • location_top_side (int.) – The unique location number on top.

  • location_bot_side (int.) – The unique location number on bot.

  • location_enemy_id (int.) – The unique number of npc whose is on location.

  • location_type (str.) – The type of location.

  • location_left_side (int.) – The unique location number on left.

  • location_right_side (int.) – The unique location number on right.

  • location_description (str.) – Description of the location.

  • current_required_item (str.) – The item is necessary to complete the location.

  • location_area (str.) – The area of the location.

async print_parameters(message: Message)#

The method outputs the necessary information about location.

Parameters:

message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only outputs to the chat.

Return type:

None.

npc.py:#

This one is responsible for all actions with the class representative NPC.

Classes:

NPC - A class for an analog of working with a NPC.

Functions:

set_npc - A method for filling in the data fields of a class representative NPC.

class npc.NPC(npc_id: int | None = None, npc_name: str | None = None, npc_item: str | None = None, npc_description: str | None = None)#

This is a conceptual class representation of an NPC.

Parameters:

  • npc_id (int.) – Unique number of the NPC.

  • npc_name (str.) – The name of the NPC.

  • npc_item (str.) – The item of the NPC.

  • npc_description (str.) – Description of a neutral character.

async print_parameters(message: Message)#

The method outputs the necessary information about NPC.

Parameters:

message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only outputs to the chat.

Return type:

None.

npc.set_npc(current_location: Location)#

The function of setting data for a specific npc.

Parameters:

current_location (Location.) – The location from which we take data for the npc.

Returns:

A representative of the class with the completed data.

Return type:

NPC.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

protagonist.py:#

This one is responsible for all actions with the class representative Protagonist.

Classes:

Protagonist - A class for an analog of working with a protagonist.

class protagonist.Protagonist(protagonist_id: int | None = None, protagonist_type: str | None = None)#

This is a conceptual class representation of a Protagonist.

Parameters:

  • protagonist_id (int.) – Unique number of the protagonist.

  • protagonist_type (int.) – The type of the protagonist.

Variables:

armor (int.) – The protagonist’s armor.

:ivar health:The protagonist’s health. :vartype health: int. :ivar agility: The protagonist’s agility. :vartype agility: int. :ivar strength: The protagonist’s strength. :vartype strength: int. :ivar level: The protagonist’s level. :vartype level: int. :ivar name: The protagonist’s name (randomly selected by other methods). :vartype name: str. :ivar inventory: The protagonist’s inventory (contains names of items). :vartype inventory: list. :ivar talked_npcs: The list of NPCs that the main character will talk to. :vartype talked_npcs: list. :ivar passed_tasks: The list of tasks that the protagonist has passed. :vartype passed_tasks: list. :ivar current_tasks: The list of tasks that the protagonist currently has. :vartype current_tasks: list. :ivar defeated_enemies: The list of enemies that the protagonist has defeated. :vartype defeated_enemies: list.

async fight(current_enemy: Enemy, message: Message)#

The method for a phased battle with the enemy.

Parameters:

  • current_enemy (Enemy.) – The entity of the enemy for the battle.

  • message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but fully displays the battle.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

go(current_location: Location)#

The method of getting available transitions.

Parameters:

current_location (Location.) – The current location where is a protagonist.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but output available locations.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

async print_parameters(message: Message)#

The method outputs the necessary information about protagonist.

Parameters:

message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only outputs to the chat.

Return type:

None.

set_level()#

The method of recalculating the level of the main character.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but calculate and set level.

Return type:

None.

set_parameters()#

The method calculates the characteristics of a character relative to its type and items.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only sets parameters of protagonist.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we do not have item or type.

set_start_item(protagonist_item: str)#

The method to add item to the protagonist inventory.

Parameters:

protagonist_item (str.) – The item for protagonist inventory.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only adds an item to the inventory.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

set_type(protagonist_type: str)#

Thу method for setting the type of protagonist.

Parameters:

protagonist_type (str.) – The type of protagonist to install.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only sets the type.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

async take_hit(value=1, message: Message | None = None)#

The method of recalculating health after taking damage.

Parameters:

  • value (int.) – The value of the damage received.

  • message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but calculate health after taking damage.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

whereami(current_location: Location)#

The method to print current location description.

Parameters:

current_location (Location.) – The current location where is a protagonist.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but output location description.

Return type:

None.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

task.py:#

This one is responsible for all actions with the class representative Task.

Classes:

Task - A class for an analog of working with a task.

Functions:

set_task - A function for filling in the data fields of a class representative Task.

class task.Task(task_id: int | None = None, task_name: str | None = None, task_description: str | None = None, task_difficult: str | None = None)#

This is a conceptual class representation of a Task.

Parameters:

  • task_id (str.) – The unique number of task.

  • task_name – The name of task.

  • task_description (str.) – The description of the task.

  • task_difficult (str.) – The difficult of the task.

async print_parameters(message: Message)#

The method outputs the necessary information about task.

Parameters:

message (Message.) – The context of the bot work is necessary for output to a specific chat.

Returns:

It does not return anything, but only outputs to the chat.

Return type:

None.

The function of setting data for a specific task.

Parameters:

current_location (Location.) – The location from which we take data for the task.

Returns:

A representative of the class with the completed data.

Return type:

Task.

Raise:

Exception: If we get incorrect argument.

Bot modules#

start.py:#

bot_data.py:#

The module is used as a dataset for working with the bot.

It can be imported into other files to work with.
